jae-hyun-park.name: Jae Hyun Park
jae-hyun-park.title: Partner
jae-hyun-park.shortDescription: Jae Park is the managing partner at Vista Law LLP. He is an Ontario lawyer and notary public.
jae-hyun-park.description: Managing Partner | Ontario Lawyer & Notary Public.

education.school: Recipient of Governor General of Canada Academic Medal (Bronze)

biography: Jae Park is the managing partner at Vista Law LLP. He is an Ontario lawyer and notary public.

He is an Ontario lawyer and notary public.  Jae strives to provide practical, creative and efficient legal solutions/advice to his clients which range from small business owners to international corporations.

Jae is a sports enthusiast, holding an official 6th degree black belt in Taekwondo.  During his spare time, you can find him teaching and sparring at his own dojang, Young Park Martial Arts in Hamilton

experience.organization: Bae, Kim & Lee LLP, Seoul, Korea (2006)

practices.description: Incorporations, Shareholder Agreements, Business Structuring, Mergers & Acquisitions, Commercial Transactions
Residential & Commercial Purchases/Sales, Leasing, Financing, Development
Franchise and licensing law services, advising franchisors and franchisees on compliance, disclosure obligations, and commercial agreements.
Wills and estates law services, including estate planning, probate, and estate administration.
Health law services, including regulatory compliance with the RCDSO and CSPO and advising on the acquisition and sale of dental practices.

notableCases.description: International and national corporations including Mobis Canada, Pantos Canada, BFI Canada (now known as Waste Connections of Canada), Golfzon Canada, Korean Exchange Bank of Canada, Shinhan Bank Canada
Negotiation/Finalization of a commercial lease for an international corporation (approximately 540,000 square feet in size and over $4 million dollars in annual rent)
Acted for a land developer on its sale of 70-home development project to a national builder
Establishment of a factory plant/warehouse for an international corporation
Sale of $5 million franchised campground business
$11 million secured financing for a private education institution
Successfully closed more than 6,000 real estate and business transactions (as of March 1, 2023)
Pro Bono legal services for war veterans who served in the Korean War and Vietnam War

theresa-wooyeon-choi.name: Theresa Wooyeon Choi
theresa-wooyeon-choi.title: Partner
theresa-wooyeon-choi.shortDescription: Theresa Wooyeon Choi is a partner at Vista Law LLP and is the head of the firm's Real Estate Department.
theresa-wooyeon-choi.description: Partner | Head of Real Estate Department
biography: Theresa Wooyeon Choi is an Ontario lawyer and notary public.

She is a partner at Vista Law LLP and is the head of the firm's Real Estate Department.  Theresa's attention to detail, along with her professional and friendly demeanor, will ensure that clients' real estate and business transactions are completed in a pleasant manner.
Theresa enjoys giving back to the community:  she regularly volunteers at not-for-profit events such as pro bono real estate law courses/seminars, human rights initiatives.

education.school: Binghamton University (State University of New York at Binghamton)

experience.organization: The Peaceful Unification Advisory Council of Korea (2020 to 2023)

practices.description: Residential and commercial real estate transactions, including purchases, sales, refinancing, and closings.
Incorporation and legal structuring for new and growing businesses, including advice on ownership and compliance.

notableCases.description: Acquisition of $9.38 million medical office building
$3.5 million private equity funding to a land developer
Successfully closed more than 2,000 real estate and business transactions (as of March 1, 2023)

steven-hong.name: Steven Hong
steven-hong.title: Partner
steven-hong.shortDescription: Steven Hong is a partner at Vista Law LLP with a focus on the areas of Commercial Law and Civil Litigation.
biography: Steven Hong is a partner at Vista Law LLP with a focus on the areas of Commercial Law and Civil Litigation.
He is fluent in both English and Korean and has a strong connection to the Korean-Canadian community in Toronto. Steven Hong obtained his law degree from the University of Western Ontario.
Outside of his practice, Steven enjoys playing sports and musical instruments. He is also an avid traveler who has visited five continents to date.

practices.description: Advising employers and employees on workplace matters, including contracts, terminations, and employment standards.
Legal support for commercial transactions, contracts, and business operations.
Corporate governance, reorganizations, and ongoing legal advice for corporations.
Residential and commercial real estate transactions, including purchases, sales, and refinancing.
Estate planning services, including wills, powers of attorney, and estate administration.

notableCases.description: Representation in various jurisdictions (Superior Court of Justice, Divisional Court, Small Claims Court, and Landlord Tenant Board)

warren-chan.name: Warren Chan
warren-chan.title: Partner
warren-chan.shortDescription: Warren Chan is a lawyer practicing in association* at Vista Law LLP.
biography: Warren Chan is a lawyer practicing in association* at Vista Law LLP.
A graduate of the Osgoode Hall Law School, Warren practices in all areas of immigration law serving both individual and corporate clients. Warren provides services in English, Chinese and Korean.
When not in the office, Warren enjoys travelling and cheering on his kids at their various sports events and activities. He is also an enthusiastic but cautious skier.

Before Visa Law LLP, Warren practiced corporate, commercial and securities law at a well-regarded boutique law firm in Toronto. Warren obtained his law degree from Osgoode Hall Law School in 2007 and was called to the Ontario Bar in 2008. He is a member of the Law Society of Upper Canada, Canadian Immigration Lawyers Association, the Canadian Bar Association and the Ontario Bar Association, Citizenship and Immigration Section and a contributor to the Canadian Bar Association Immigration Section, including its guide to the Canada-European Union (EU) Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA).
*Warren Chan is the Principal of Warren Chan Professional Corporation, through which he practices in association with Vista Law LLP.

experience.organization: Warren Chan Professional Corporation (Practicing in Association with Vista Law LLP)
Boutique Law Firm, Toronto (Prior to Vista Law LLP)

practices.description: Assistance with federal skilled worker, skilled trades, and Canadian experience class applications.

practices.shortName: Provincial Nominee Programs (PNP) & Atlantic Immigration Program (AIP)
practices.description: Guidance on immigration programs run by provinces and Atlantic regions to support employer-driven and skilled worker applications.
Helping Canadian citizens and permanent residents sponsor eligible family members.
Applications for temporary work permits, including LMIA-based, investor, intra-company transferee, and significant benefit categories.
Assistance with study permit applications and extensions for international students.
Representation in special immigration applications based on humanitarian and compassionate considerations.
Addressing immigration inadmissibility issues, including criminal history and rehabilitation applications.

chan-yeung-kang.name: Chan Yeung Kang
chan-yeung-kang.title: Counsel to the Firm
chan-yeung-kang.shortDescription: Chan Yeung Kang is the first-ever Korean Canadian Lawyer in Canada.
chan-yeung-kang.description: Honorary Member | Retired as of July 1, 2025
biography: Chan Yeung Kang is the first-ever Korean Canadian Lawyer in Canada.  He retired from the practice of law as of July 1, 2025 and will remain as an honorary member of Vista Law LLP.

practices.description: Residential and commercial real estate transactions, including purchases, sales, and refinancing.

Legal support for establishing, managing, and maintaining non-profit organizations.
Estate planning, wills, powers of attorney, and estate administration.
Witnessing and certifying documents, affidavits, and international notarizations

notableCases.description: Registering several hundreds of churches as charities with Canada Revenue Agency, including other non-profit organizations such as Korean Cultural Association, Arirang Age-Friendly Community Centre, Canada YLT Scholarship Foundation, Korean Canadian Alzheimer's Society, Good Farmers Canada, Good Neighbours Canada, Hope Network for the Ecosystem, Korean Canadian Church Music, Maum Family Care Centre, Stretched Arm Society, and etc.
